sentences: Mõlemad poiss ja tüdruk tulid koos kooli.
Ta ei võtnud mõlemat pakki kaasa.
context: The word 'mõlemat' is the partitive case form of 'mõlemad', meaning 'both'. In Estonian, this form is used when referring to both items or people in contexts where they are being acted upon or considered as objects. The partitive case indicates an incomplete action or partial possession.
